snippet: The New York City police commissioner has acknowledged that the culture of his department needs changing.
abstract: Editorial supports New York Police Commissioner William Bratton's plan to re-educate all 35,000 of city's police officers in effort to avoid another situation like death of Eric Garner during brutal arrest on Staten Island; warns program, estimated to cost $25 million to $30 million, will be expensive and that its efficacy has yet to be proven; holds true test of plan will be not in subsequent police data but in whether department regains trust of communities affected by police brutality.
lead_paragraph: The New York City police commissioner has acknowledged that the culture of his department needs changing.

headline.main: Mr. Bratton Reverses to Go Forward
headline.print_headline: Mr. Bratton Reverses to Go Forward
